channel.title: Posts on Vedant Writes
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Vedant Writes

item.title: How I Automated My Blog: CI/CD Setup for the Lazy Data Engineer
item.description:
As a data engineer, I spend most of my time wrangling data, setting up pipelines, and automating things. So when it came to my personal blog, I decided to follow my own advice and automate everything I could. Writing blog posts manually? Out. Manual deployment? Out. In comes the magic of CI/CD—Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment.

Here’s how I set up an automated blog using Hugo, GitHub, and Netlify, all while keeping my sanity (and saving a lot of time).

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide v2
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
